class.name: DocumentCreated
class.description: The DocumentCreated object is the top level object created by Application.CreateDocument. A DocumentCreated object is a special Document object.

properties.name: body
properties.description: Gets the body object of the document. The body is the text that excludes headers, footers, footnotes, textboxes, etc.

examples.description: Add a paragraph of text to the document body after creating a new document

properties.name: contentControls
properties.description: Gets the collection of content control objects in the document. This includes content controls in the body of the document, headers, footers, textboxes, etc.

examples.description: Find and highlight all content controls in a newly created document by setting their appearance to tags visible

properties.name: context
properties.description: The request context associated with the object. This connects the add-in's process to the Office host application's process.

examples.description: Access the request context from a newly created document to synchronize operations with the Office host application

properties.name: customXmlParts
properties.description: Gets the custom XML parts in the document.

examples.description: Add a custom XML part to a newly created document and then retrieve all custom XML parts to verify it was added.

properties.name: properties
properties.description: Gets the properties of the document.

examples.description: Read and display the document's title and author from the document properties.

properties.name: saved
properties.description: Indicates whether the changes in the document have been saved. A value of true indicates that the document hasn't changed since it was saved.

examples.description: Check if a newly created document has unsaved changes and display an appropriate message to the user

properties.name: sections
properties.description: Gets the collection of section objects in the document.

examples.description: Get all sections in a newly created document and display the count of sections in the console.

properties.name: settings
properties.description: Gets the add-in's settings in the document.

examples.description: Store and retrieve a custom user preference setting in the document, such as saving a "lastViewedSection" value that persists with the document.

methods.name: addStyle
methods.description: Adds a style into the document by name and type.

params.name: name
params.description: A string representing the style name.

params.name: type
params.description: The style type, including character, list, paragraph, or table.

params.name: name
params.description: A string representing the style name.

params.name: type
params.description: The style type, including character, list, paragraph, or table.

examples.description: Add a new character style named "HighlightText" and a paragraph style named "CustomHeading" to the document

methods.name: deleteBookmark
methods.description: Deletes a bookmark, if it exists, from the document.

params.name: name
params.description: The case-insensitive bookmark name.

examples.description: Delete a bookmark named "Section1Start" from the document

methods.name: getBookmarkRange
methods.description: Gets a bookmark's range. Throws an ItemNotFound error if the bookmark doesn't exist.

params.name: name
params.description: The case-insensitive bookmark name.

examples.description: Retrieve the text content from a bookmark named "CompanyName" in the document

methods.name: getBookmarkRangeOrNullObject
methods.description: Gets a bookmark's range. If the bookmark doesn't exist, then this method will return an object with its isNullObject property set to true. For further information, see [*OrNullObject methods and properties](/en-us/office/dev/add-ins/develop/application-specific-api-model#ornullobject-methods-and-properties).

params.name: name
params.description: The case-insensitive bookmark name. Only alphanumeric and underscore characters are supported. It must begin with a letter but if you want to tag the bookmark as hidden, then start the name with an underscore character. Names can't be longer than 40 characters.

examples.description: Check if a bookmark named "Introduction" exists in the document and highlight its text, or show a message if the bookmark is not found.

methods.name: getContentControls
methods.description: Gets the currently supported content controls in the document.

params.name: options
params.description: Options that define which content controls are returned.

examples.description: Get all content controls in a newly created document and log their count to the console

methods.name: getStyles
methods.description: Gets a StyleCollection object that represents the whole style set of the document.

examples.description: Get all styles from a newly created document and log the name of each style to the console.

methods.name: insertFileFromBase64
methods.description: Inserts a document into the target document at a specific location with additional properties. Headers, footers, watermarks, and other section properties are copied by default.

params.name: base64File
params.description: The Base64-encoded content of a .docx file.

params.name: insertLocation
params.description: The value must be 'Replace', 'Start', or 'End'.

params.name: insertFileOptions
params.description: The additional properties that should be imported to the destination document.

examples.description: Insert a template document from a base64-encoded file into the current document at the end, including all headers and footers

methods.name: load
methods.description: Queues up a command to load the specified properties of the object. You must call context.sync() before reading the properties.

params.name: options
params.description: Provides options for which properties of the object to load.

params.name: propertyNames
params.description: A comma-delimited string or an array of strings that specify the properties to load.

params.name: propertyNamesAndPaths
params.description: propertyNamesAndPaths.select is a comma-delimited string that specifies the properties to load, and propertyNamesAndPaths.expand is a comma-delimited string that specifies the navigation properties to load.

examples.description: Create a new document and load its properties to verify the document was created successfully before performing operations on it.
Create a new Word document and open it in a separate tab or window.

params.name: saveBehavior
params.description: DocumentCreated only supports 'Save'.

params.name: fileName
params.description: The file name (exclude file extension). Only takes effect for a new document.

params.name: saveBehavior
params.description: DocumentCreated only supports 'Save'.

params.name: fileName
params.description: The file name (exclude file extension). Only takes effect for a new document.

examples.description: Create a new document, add content to it, and save it to a specific file location

methods.name: set
methods.description: Sets multiple properties of an object at the same time. You can pass either a plain object with the appropriate properties, or another API object of the same type.

params.name: properties
params.description: A JavaScript object with properties that are structured isomorphically to the properties of the object on which the method is called.

params.name: options
params.description: Provides an option to suppress errors if the properties object tries to set any read-only properties.

examples.description: Set multiple properties on a newly created document, including title and subject metadata

methods.name: toJSON
methods.description: Overrides the JavaScript toJSON() method in order to provide more useful output when an API object is passed to JSON.stringify(). (JSON.stringify, in turn, calls the toJSON method of the object that's passed to it.) Whereas the original Word.DocumentCreated object is an API object, the toJSON method returns a plain JavaScript object (typed as Word.Interfaces.DocumentCreatedData) that contains shallow copies of any loaded child properties from the original object.

examples.description: Create a new document and serialize its properties to JSON format for logging or data transfer purposes.

methods.name: track
methods.description: Track the object for automatic adjustment based on surrounding changes in the document. This call is a shorthand for [context.trackedObjects.add(thisObject)](/en-us/javascript/api/office/officeextension.clientrequestcontext#office-officeextension-clientrequestcontext-trackedobjects-member). If you're using this object across .sync calls and outside the sequential execution of a ".run" batch, and get an "InvalidObjectPath" error when setting a property or invoking a method on the object, you need to add the object to the tracked object collection when the object was first created. If this object is part of a collection, you should also track the parent collection.

examples.description: Create a new document and track it to safely access its properties across multiple sync calls without getting an "InvalidObjectPath" error

methods.name: untrack
methods.description: Release the memory associated with this object, if it has previously been tracked. This call is shorthand for [context.trackedObjects.remove(thisObject)](/en-us/javascript/api/office/officeextension.clientrequestcontext#office-officeextension-clientrequestcontext-trackedobjects-member). Having many tracked objects slows down the host application, so please remember to free any objects you add, once you're done using them. You'll need to call context.sync() before the memory release takes effect.

examples.description: Create a new document, add content to it, and properly release the tracked DocumentCreated object from memory after use
